rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0315/100315-john-okeefe">       <rss:title>The Life Scientific: John O'Keefe</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0315/100315-john-okeefe</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Professor John O\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdKeefe (UCL Cell &amp; Developmental Biology) explains his research into 'place cells' in the brain and what it was like to win a Nobel Prize.  Listen: BBC Radio 4 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe Life Scientific\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd  </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-03-10T14:47:28Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0315/050315-first-human">       <rss:title>'First human' discovered in Ethiopia</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0315/050315-first-human</rss:link>       <rss:description>                A state-of-the-art computer reconstruction of a Homo habilis fossil by Professor Fred Spoor (UCL Cell &amp; Developmental Biology) indicates that the species has older evolutionary roots than previously thought.  Read: BBC News ,  More: Guardian ,  Independent ,  The Week ,  NY Times ,  Los Angeles Times ,  NBC ,  New Scientist ,  National Geographic ,  Discovery ,  Science ,  UCL News ,  Listen: BBC Radio 4 'Six O'Clock News' (from 15 mins 45 secs) ,  More: BBC Radio 4 'The World Tonight' (from 6 mins 39 secs)  </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-03-05T12:27:01Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/260215-kew-gardens">       <rss:title>Kew Gardens unveils science strategy</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/260215-kew-gardens</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Commenting on the future of Kew Gardens Professor Georgina Mace (UCL Genetics, Evolution &amp; Environment) says: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMore cuts could mean it simply cannot function as an international plant centre with the reputation it has at the moment\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.  Read: BBC News ,  Listen: BBC Radio 4 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe World Tonight\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (from 43 mins 19 secs) </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-02-26T11:56:38Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/160215-fad-diets">       <rss:title>Health chiefs dismiss fad diets as money-spinning \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdnutribabble\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/160215-fad-diets</rss:link>       <rss:description>    Professor David Colquhoun (UCL Neuroscience, Physiology &amp; Pharmacology) says a lot of diet marketing can be summed up as \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdnutribabble\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.  Read: Times (\ufffd\ufffd) </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-02-16T11:26:37Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/130215-unrequited-love">       <rss:title>How unrequited love can make us more creative</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/130215-unrequited-love</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Professor Semir Zeki (UCL Cell &amp; Developmental Biology) argues that creativity is a natural, though not necessarily inevitable, reaction to love\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds frustrations.  Read: Washington Post </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-02-13T11:35:29Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/130215-complex-cells">       <rss:title>We've got the evolution of complex cells inside-out</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/130215-complex-cells</rss:link>       <rss:description>    Professor Buzz Baum (UCL/MRC Lab for Molecular Cell Biology) explains how complex cells evolved on Earth.  Read: New Scientist (\ufffd\ufffd)  </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-02-13T11:09:20Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/120215-darwin-finches-tree">       <rss:title>Genomes reveal Darwin finches' messy family tree</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/120215-darwin-finches-tree</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Commenting on a genetic study of Darwin\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds finches, Dr Julia Day (UCL Genetics, Evolution &amp; Environment) says the level of reported mixing between the finch species is &quot;a textbook example of radiation&quot;.  Read: BBC News </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-02-12T16:57:27Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/120215-darwin-finches">       <rss:title>Darwin\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds finches reveal role of genes in evolution</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/120215-darwin-finches</rss:link>       <rss:description>      Professor Steve Jones (UCL Genetics, Evolution &amp; Environment) comments on a new study which has identified the genetic mechanism that allows for the development of different beak shapes in birds.  Read: Wall Street Journal (\ufffd\ufffd) </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-02-12T15:04:51Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/030215-honours-degrees">       <rss:title>Honours degrees aren't for all \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd some unis should only teach two-year courses</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0215/030215-honours-degrees</rss:link>       <rss:description>                   Professor David Colquhoun (UCL Neuroscience, Physiology &amp; Pharmacology) explains why a two stage-system where some universities focus on teaching and others  become postgrad institutions would save money and be more egalitarian.  Read: Guardian  </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-02-03T16:17:22Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0115/200115-man-v-milk">       <rss:title>Man v milk</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0115/200115-man-v-milk</rss:link>       <rss:description>    Professor Mark Thomas (UCL Genetics, Evolution &amp; Environment) helps to explain how the ability to drink milk forged the course of human evolution.  Listen: BBC World Service Radio \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe Food Chain\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (from 5 mins 56 secs)  </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-01-20T10:50:06Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0115/150115-duchess-diet">       <rss:title>Duchess in the soup over her diet plan for America</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0115/150115-duchess-diet</rss:link>       <rss:description>    Professor David Colquhoun (UCL Neuroscience, Physiology &amp; Pharmacology) comments on Sarah, Duchess of York\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds role as an ambassador for Imperial College London and her apparent use of the association to promote a diet system.  Read: Times (\ufffd\ufffd) ,  More: The Australian (\ufffd\ufffd)   </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-01-15T11:14:54Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0115/140115-under-80-cancer">       <rss:title>By 2050 no one under 80 will be dying from cancer</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/0115/140115-under-80-cancer</rss:link>       <rss:description>                  A report led by Professor David Taylor (UCL Pharmacy) has suggested that by 2050 deaths from cancer will be \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdeliminated\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd for all age groups except the over-80s by 2050, if recent gains in prevention and treatment carry on apace.  Read: Independent ,  More: Times (\ufffd\ufffd) ,  Telegraph ,  Daily Mail ,  ITV News ,  Metro ,  Listen: BBC Radio 5 live 'Afternoon Edition' (from 11 mins 53 secs) ,  More: BBC London 94.9 'Drivetime' (from 44 mins)  </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-01-14T09:36:36Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/221214-moments-in-science">       <rss:title>The 12 most important moments in science in 2014</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/221214-moments-in-science</rss:link>       <rss:description>Professor Sophie Scott, Professor Sarah-Jayne Blakemore (both UCL Cognitive Neuroscience), Dr Helen Czerski and Professor Mark Miodownik (both UCL Mechanical Engineering) pick their key scientific moments of the year \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd including Professor John O\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdKeefe (UCL Cell &amp; Developmental Biology) being awarded the Nobel Prize.  Read: Guardian </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-12-22T09:50:38Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/141214-prescription-statistics">       <rss:title>Prescription statistics</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/141214-prescription-statistics</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Professor David Colquhoun (UCL Neuroscience, Physiology &amp; Pharmacology) comments on the latest statistics for prescription use from the Health Survey for England.  Listen: BBC Radio 5 live \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSunday Breakfast\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (from 2 hours 33 mins) </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-12-15T16:07:11Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/121214-herbal-slimming-pills">       <rss:title>Fake Britain: herbal slimming pills</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/121214-herbal-slimming-pills</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Professor Simon Gibbons (UCL School of Pharmacy) analyses fake \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdherbal\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd slimming pills bought online for the banned substance sibutramine.  Watch: BBC One \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFake Britain\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (from 38 mins 48 secs) </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-12-12T12:13:17Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/091214-premenstrual-syndrome">       <rss:title>Premenstrual Syndrome is like drug withdrawal</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/091214-premenstrual-syndrome</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Research co-led by Dr Jonathan Fry (UCL Neuroscience, Physiology &amp; Pharmacology) and Bristol University has found that a small monthly dose of Prozac could cure PMS for four fifths of women.  Read: Telegraph ,  More: The Conversation  </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-12-09T09:55:32Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/081214-text-message">       <rss:title>Text messaging service 'helps people take their pills'</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/081214-text-message</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Professor David Taylor (UCL Pharmacy) says text messaging could be coupled with each relevant prescription and prevent several thousand heart attacks and strokes in the UK annually.  Read: BBC News </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-12-08T12:19:20Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/031214-cancer-signs">       <rss:title>Most people ignore signs of cancer</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/031214-cancer-signs</rss:link>       <rss:description>  A study led by Dr Katriina Whitaker (UCL Health Behaviour Research Centre) has found that people are putting their lives at risk by dismissing the warning signs of cancer.  Read: Guardian ,  More: Times (\ufffd\ufffd) ,  Daily Mail ,  Independent </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-12-03T11:22:06Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/031214-genetic-test">       <rss:title>\ufffd\ufffd125 genetic test kit backed by Google arrives in Britain \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd with a health warning</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/031214-genetic-test</rss:link>       <rss:description>        Commenting on a new Google-backed genetic test, Professor Mark Thomas (UCL Genetics, Evolution &amp; Environment) says that: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFor better or worse, direct-to-the-consumer genetic testing companies are here to stay\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.  Read: Daily Mail ,  More: Independent ,  Listen: BBC World Service 'Newshour' (from 46 mins 57 secs) ,  Watch: BBC 2 'Newsnight' (from 24 mins)  </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-12-03T10:23:38Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/031214-richard-iii">       <rss:title>DNA Confirms: Here Lieth Richard III, Under Yon Parking Lot</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1214/031214-richard-iii</rss:link>       <rss:description>    A statistical analysis led by Professor Mark Thomas and Professor David Balding (UCL Genetics, Evolution &amp; Environment) has combined several different lines of evidence to confirm that \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSkeleton 1\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, discovered in a car park in Leicester, is that of Richard III.  Read: National Geographic ,  More: UCL News </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-12-03T10:08:07Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/271114-extreme-weather">       <rss:title>Risk from extreme weather set to rise</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/271114-extreme-weather</rss:link>       <rss:description>  A Royal Society report headed by Professor Georgina Mace (UCL Genetics, Evolution &amp; Environment) has found that the risk to the elderly from heatwaves could increase tenfold in Britain this century because of climate change and an ageing population.  Read: BBC News ,  More: Times </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-11-27T10:58:54Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/261114-internet-elderly-health">       <rss:title>Internet usage boosts health of the elderly</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/261114-internet-elderly-health</rss:link>       <rss:description>  A study led by Lindsay Kobayashi (UCL Epidemiology &amp; Health) has found that older people who use the internet regularly are healthier because they are better informed about medical issues.  Read: Daily Mail ,  More: Daily Express </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-11-26T10:08:49Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/121114-gene-switch">       <rss:title>Scientists develop thought-controlled gene switch</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/121114-gene-switch</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Professor Geraint Rees (UCL Life Sciences) comments on a study that reports genes can be switched on using the power of thought.  Read: BBC News </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-11-12T10:44:15Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/101114-hay-levels">       <rss:title>Hay Levels: bite-sized answers to the big questions</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/101114-hay-levels</rss:link>       <rss:description>  A new series of free five minute mini-lectures aimed at A-level students, titled the Hay Levels, have been launched online as a spin off from the Hay Festival and includes a talk by Professor Steve Jones (UCL Genetics, Evolution &amp; Environment).  Read: Telegraph </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-11-10T11:22:44Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/071114-bat-sabotage">       <rss:title>Bats sabotage rivals' senses with sound in food race</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/headlines/1114/071114-bat-sabotage</rss:link>       <rss:description>  Professor Kate Jones (UCL Genetics, Evolution &amp; Environment) comments on a study which has found a species of bat that can interfere with the sound signals of competitors to &quot;steal&quot; their food, saying: &quot;Technology is opening up our understanding of these deeply cryptic creatures&quot;.  Read: BBC News </rss:description>       <dc:subject>UCL News</dc:subject>       <dc:creator>Siobhan Pipa</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-11-07T12:17:58Z</dc:date>                                 </rss:item>    </rdf:RDF>
